newsitem.title: UK: Man jailed for 6 months for mobile phone car crash.
newsitem.headline: Man jailed for 6 months for mobile phone car crash.

text.p: A 35-year-old banking executive was sentenced to six months in prison by a British court on Friday for causing a fatal car accident while talking on his mobile phone.
Peter Mill had been listening to his messages as he approached a bend in the road. His Rover veered into the other lane and smashed into an oncoming van, killing its driver.

Earlier this week the British government announced it would not introduce legislation banning motorists from using mobile phones at the wheel, despite growing demands for such a ban from safety groups.

Car phone-related deaths have attracted widespread attention in Britain recently after a string of fatal crashes. Last month a man was fined 250 pounds ($400) for careless driving when he caused an accident in which an 11-year-old girl died while he was making a call to his wife.
A jury in Texas on Tuesday ordered an 18-year-old girl to pay about $7 million in damages to the family of a boy killed when she lost control of her vehicle while answering a mobile phone.
